episodes.title: They Called It Satan. It Was Schizophrenia
episodes.description:
What happens when untreated mental illness meets religious control? This video talks about the disturbing link between schizophrenia and Jehovah’s Witnesses and why no one’s talking about it.

Spencer, J. (1975). Schizophrenia and Jehovah’s Witnesses. PubMed

Montague, H. (1977). Mental illness among JWs. Equip.org

Pescor, M.J. (1949). U.S. Army psychiatric evaluation of JWs

Living with Schizophrenia UK – Religious Delusions

JWfacts.com – Psychiatry and Mental Health

JourneyFree.org – Religious Trauma Syndrome

Reddit – ExJW Discussions on Mental Health


#ExJW #JehovahsWitnesses #MentalHealthAwareness #ReligiousTrauma #Schizophrenia #HighControlGroups #WatchtowerTruth #ExJWRecovery #CultRecovery #RTS #SpiritualAbuse

episodes.title: Chapter 30 THE END JW Elders Secret Manual
episodes.description:
I take the very last chunk of the Elders Manual, Chapter 30 plus its appendices to hold it up to the light, and show how it really works. Think muzzled interviews, free labour for fancy Kingdom Halls, and congregations run like fast-food franchises. 
#ExJW #JehovahsWitnesses #Watchtower #EldersManual #CultControl #InformationLockdown #SpiritualAbuse #ReligiousTrauma #FreeSpeech #ExposeTheTruth

episodes.title: Angry? Good. Just Don’t Be a Jerk About It. JW Style
episodes.description:
Why are ex-Jehovah’s Witnesses so angry and why do active Witnesses get even angrier when we leave? In this deep dive, Today we touch on the trauma, the emotional outbursts, and the truth behind it all. From nervous system overload to cult-level tantrums. Healing is messy but cruelty isn’t part of the plan.

#ExJWDanny #ReligiousTrauma #JehovahsWitnesses #ExJW #CultRecovery #SpiritualAbuse #HighControlReligion #AngerAfterLeaving #HealingJourney #WhyWereAngry

Van der Kolk, Bessel. The Body Keeps the Score: Brain, Mind, and Body in the Healing of Trauma. Penguin Books, 2015.
– Foundational text on how trauma is stored in the body and affects behavior long after the event.

Levine, Peter A. Waking the Tiger: Healing Trauma. North Atlantic Books, 1997.
– Introduces somatic experiencing and explains how trauma responses like fight/flight/freeze shape our reactions.

Fisher, Janina. Healing the Fragmented Selves of Trauma Survivors: Overcoming Internal Self-Alienation. Routledge, 2017.
– Discusses how trauma can fragment the self and create conflicting emotional states, like anger turned inward or projected outward.

Lerner, Harriet. The Dance of Anger: A Woman’s Guide to Changing the Patterns of Intimate Relationships. Harper Perennial, 2005.
– A powerful resource for understanding how anger can be both constructive and destructive in relationships.

episodes.title: Gaslight, Gatekeep, Governing Body: The DARVO Edition
episodes.description:
They deny it. They attack you. Then they play the victim.
This is DARVO — and it’s the Jehovah’s Witness Governing Body’s favourite tactic. 
#ExJW #JehovahsWitnesses #ReligiousTrauma #DARVO#SpiritualAbuse
#ExJWCommunity #CultRecovery #WatchtowerExposed #governingbody 
#ShunningHurts #HighControlGroup #ReligiousGaslighting


Freyd, Jennifer J. (1997). Violations of power, adaptive blindness, and betrayal trauma theory.

Source of DARVO concept.

https://dynamic.uoregon.edu/jjf/darvo.html

Freyd, J. J. & Smidt, A. M. (2019). Institutional betrayal and institutional courage.

Journal of Trauma & Dissociation, 20(5), 491–499.

Australian Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse – Case Study 29 (Jehovah’s Witnesses).

Found over 1,000 accused abusers not reported.

https://www.childabuseroyalcommission.gov.au

Watchtower, July 15, 2011, p. 11

Referred to former members as “mentally diseased.”

Watchtower, April 15, 2012, p. 12

Instruction to avoid disfellowshipped family “to the extent possible.”

JW Broadcasting, July 2017

Governing Body member Anthony Morris III warns members against “apostate-driven lies.”

Watchtower, January 15, 2013, p. 16

“Jehovah expects us to be loyal even when we don’t understand.”

episodes.title: Jehovah’s Witnesses: Psychological Warfare 101
episodes.description:
Psychological warfare in Jehovah’s name. From fear to shame to full-blown mind control. Today, I am diving into the cult tactics hiding behind a clean-cut religious image. Shunning, sexual guilt, and emotional exile,they used it all. And we’re done being silent.

#exjw #jehovahswitnesses #cultrecovery #cultawareness #religiouscontrol

episodes.title: Why Jehovah’s Witnesses Are So Confused?
episodes.description:
Many Jehovah’s Witnesses are emotionally exhausted, confused, and struggling to make sense of it all ,and it’s not their fault. Today I look at some of the contradictions in doctrine, policy, and daily life that create chronic confusion and emotional distress. 

#exjw  #jehovahswitnesses #cultawareness #cultrecovery #cults

episodes.title: Polyvagal Theory, Fawning, and Fear: How Cults Rewire Your Body
episodes.description:
Today, we are addressing how high-control religion, specifically Jehovah’s Witnesses, hijacks your nervous system. We talk about Polyvagal Theory, trauma responses like fawning and hypervigilance, somatic memory, and even internalized surveillance. This isn’t just emotional damage.

Bessel van der Kolk, M.D.
The Body Keeps the Score: Brain, Mind, and Body in the Healing of Trauma
(Penguin Books, 2014)
 Stephen W. Porges, Ph.D.
The Polyvagal Theory: Neurophysiological Foundations of Emotions, 
Peter A. Levine, Ph.D.
Waking the Tiger: Healing Trauma
(North Atlantic Books, 1997)
. Judith Herman, M.D.
Trauma and Recovery: The Aftermath of Violence—From Domestic Abuse to Political Terror
(Basic Books, 1992)
Michel Foucault
Discipline and Punish: The Birth of the Prison
(Pantheon Books, 1975)
 Pete Walker, M.A., MFT
Complex PTSD: From Surviving to Thriving
(2013, self-published)
 Martin Seligman, Ph.D.
Learned Helplessness Theory


8. Leon Festinger
Cognitive Dissonance Theory
➤ When a person holds conflicting beliefs (e.g., “Jehovah loves me” vs. “I feel terrified”), they experience psychological discomfort and try to resolve the tension by altering their perception of reality.

9. National Institutes of Health (NIH)
https://www.nih.gov
10. Cleveland Clinic – Stress & Chronic Illness
https://my.clevelandclinic.org

episodes.title: The 1914 Prophecy  A Timeline of Confusion #exjw #horror
They Called It Help, It Was Neglect.
episodes.description:
I went back and read the October 2022 Watchtower article titled “How to Help Those With Mental Health Challenges.” What I found wasn’t help—it was  shallow advice, and silence around the real issues. Today I break down the article piece by piece, talk about why it’s so damaging, and share what real support should look like, because some of us didn’t survive this kind of “help,” and the rest of us are still healing.

https://www.jw.org/en/library/magazines/watchtower-no1-2023/help-those-with-mental-health-challenges/

The Question That Broke My Brain (In a Good Way)
episodes.description:
What if you woke up tomorrow and all the Watchtower baggage was gone? No guilt, no fear, no elder in your head. Today I wanted to talk about something I’ve used a ton in my own healing , it’s called The Miracle Question. It’s simple, weirdly powerful, and might just shift how you see your whole life after leaving Jehovah’s Witnesses. Keep an open mind, and let’s imagine what freedom really looks like.
#ExJW
#ExJWRecovery
#ReligiousTrauma
#TheMiracleQuestion
#CPTSDRecovery
#LeavingTheCult
#JehovahsWitnesses
#HealingAfterReligion
#SpiritualAbuse
#FreedomFromFear
#ExJWHealing
#LifeAfterWatchtower
#Deprogramming
#ExJWCommunity
#MentalClarity
Sources:
de Shazer, S. (1988). Clues: Investigating Solutions in Brief Therapy. Norton.
– Foundational work where the Miracle Question was first introduced in solution-focused brief therapy.

de Shazer, S., & Dolan, Y. (2007). More Than Miracles: The State of the Art of Solution-Focused Brief Therapy. Routledge.
– A modern continuation of the principles behind the Miracle Question, offering real-world application.

Ratner, H., George, E., & Iveson, C. (2012). Solution Focused Brief Therapy: 100 Key Points and Techniques. Routledge.
– Offers simplified, practical explanations and techniques including the Miracle Question.

Berg, I. K., & Miller, S. D. (1992). Working with the Problem Drinker: A Solution-Focused Approach. Norton.
– Demonstrates how the Miracle Question and solution-focused thinking can help people shift from hopelessness to possibility.

episodes.title: JW Men Deserved Better (And You Know It)
episodes.description:
Most of my viewers are men, and I see the silent struggle. Today we talk about what it really meant to be a “man” in the JW world: the pressure, the shame, the silence, and the fallout. 

Drop a comment—your story might help someone else find their voice.

#ExJW #JehovahsWitnesses #JWMen #CultRecovery #ReligiousTrauma #ExJWCommunity #MenAndHealing #SpiritualAbuse #WakingUp #ExJWSupport #MentalHealth #Masculinity #BreakingFree #ExJWTestimony #HighControlGroups

episodes.title: It Wasn’t All a Waste: You Took Something With You
episodes.description:
This video is for anyone who’s ever felt like they wasted their life in a high-control religion. But the truth is, you didn’t leave empty-handed. You took strength, empathy, resilience, and so much more. This is a gentle reminder that you’re not broken. You’re becoming. And I’m so glad you’re still here.

episodes.description:
Today I am talking about Chapters 28 and 29 of the Jehovah’s Witness elder manual, Shepherd the Flock of God, exposing how the organization handles imprisoned members and legal matters—not with compassion, but with cold, calculated control. From judicial committees behind bars to gag orders in child custody battles, this analysis reveals the corporate paranoia,  obsession, and detachment that define the organization's approach.

episodes.title: Natural Instincts? Not in This Religion
episodes.description:
This isn’t just about religion, it’s about what happens when a group convinces people to go against everything that makes us human. Today we look at how Jehovah’s Witnesses are taught to shut down their instincts, cut off their kids, deny life-saving medical care, and call it “love.” It’s painful, it’s real, and it’s happening to millions. Let’s talk about it.

#jehovah'switnessexposed, #watchtowersociety, #jwgoverningbody, #jwshunning,#disfellowshipping, #pimopomipomo, #jwculttactics, #jwdoctrinebreakdown, #exjw,#exjehovah'switness, #exjwtestimony, #exjwstory, #exjwexperience, #leavingjehovah'switnesses,#lifeafterjw, #exjwtruth, #jehovah'switnessexposed, #watchtowersociety, #jwgoverningbody,#jwshunning, #disfellowshipping, #pimopomipomo, #jwculttactics, #jwdoctrinebreakdown

episodes.title: Gaslighting and the Rhythm of Recovery
episodes.description:
You were told not to trust your heart, your thoughts, or even your memories. That’s not spiritual guidance , that’s gaslighting. Today I want to talk about how high-control religion rewires your nervous system to live in fear, shame, and obedience. More importantly, we walk through how to reclaim trust in yourself, one small step at a time. Your nervous system isn’t broken — it’s just learning a new rhythm: freedom.

#jehovah'switnessexposed, #watchtowersociety, #jwgoverningbody, #jwshunning,#disfellowshipping, #pimopomipomo, #jwculttactics, #jwdoctrinebreakdown, #exjw,#exjehovah'switness, #exjwtestimony, #exjwstory, #exjwexperience, #leavingjehovah'switnesses,#lifeafterjw, #exjwtruth, #jehovah'switnessexposed, #watchtowersociety, #jwgoverningbody,#jwshunning, #disfellowshipping, #pimopomipomo, #jwculttactics, #jwdoctrinebreakdown
Stern, R. (2007). The Gaslight Effect: How to Spot and Survive the Hidden Manipulation Others Use to Control Your Life. Broadway Books.
→ Foundational work defining gaslighting in relationships and systems.

Winell, M. (2011). Leaving the Fold: A Guide for Former Fundamentalists and Others Leaving Their Religion. New Harbinger Publications.
→ Introduces the concept of Religious Trauma Syndrome and recovery from spiritual abuse.

Festinger, L. (1957). A Theory of Cognitive Dissonance. Stanford University Press.
→ Core psychological theory explaining the mental discomfort of conflicting beliefs and behaviors.

Fisher, J. (2017). Healing the Fragmented Selves of Trauma Survivors: Overcoming Internal Self-Alienation. Routledge.
→ Explores trauma integration, dissociation, and nervous system healing.

Hassan, S. (2015). Combating Cult Mind Control: The #1 Best-selling Guide to Protection, Rescue, and Recovery from Destructive Cults. Freedom of Mind Press.
→ An essential guide to understanding cult tactics and psychological recovery.

episodes.title: Never Enough: How Jehovah’s Witnesses Are Conditioned to Drown in Guilt
episodes.description:
Today I'm talking guilt culture within Jehovah’s Witnesses, revealing how members are conditioned to feel like they're never doing enough, no matter how much they sacrifice. From meeting prep and field service quotas to the emotional toll of constant surveillance and conditional love, this piece breaks down the psychological burden of spiritual hustle.

#jehovah'switnessexposed, #watchtowersociety, #jwgoverningbody, #jwshunning,#disfellowshipping, #pimopomipomo, #jwculttactics, #jwdoctrinebreakdown, #exjw,#exjehovah'switness, #exjwtestimony, #exjwstory, #exjwexperience, #leavingjehovah'switnesses,#lifeafterjw, #exjwtruth, #jehovah'switnessexposed, #watchtowersociety, #jwgoverningbody,#jwshunning, #disfellowshipping, #pimopomipomo, #jwculttactics, #jwdoctrinebreakdown
The Watchtower, February 2018 — “We May Feel That We Are Never Doing Enough for Jehovah”

The Watchtower, May 2019 — “Jehovah Deserves Our Best”

The Watchtower, July 2019 — “Satan Wants Us to Slow Down”

The Watchtower, March 2016 — “Are You Regularly Studying?”

The Watchtower, October 2016 — “Jehovah Notices Our Faithfulness”

Steven Hassan, Combating Cult Mind Control

Margaret Thaler Singer, Cults in Our Midst

Raymond Franz, Crisis of Conscience

episodes.title: Chapters 26 & 27: Storms, Ceremonies, and Control
episodes.description:
Chapters 26 and 27 of the elder manual may seem unrelated. Disaster response and weddings, but both reveal the same obsession: control. Whether it’s a natural catastrophe or a walk down the aisle, Jehovah’s Witnesses are expected to follow rigid protocols that prioritize image and hierarchy over humanity. From keeping the emergency hotline secret to micromanaging wedding playlists and bridal parties, these chapters show that nothing—not even love or loss—escapes organizational oversight.

#jehovah'switnessexposed, #watchtowersociety, #jwgoverningbody, #jwshunning,#disfellowshipping, #pimopomipomo, #jwculttactics, #jwdoctrinebreakdown, #exjw,#exjehovah'switness, #exjwtestimony, #exjwstory, #exjwexperience, #leavingjehovah'switnesses,#lifeafterjw, #exjwtruth, #jehovah'switnessexposed, #watchtowersociety, #jwgoverningbody,#jwshunning, #disfellowshipping, #pimopomipomo, #jwculttactics, #jwdoctrinebreakdown

episodes.title: Doomsday Addiction: Why JWs Are Always Expecting The End
episodes.description:
Why are Jehovah’s Witnesses obsessed with the world ending? Today I talk about some potential reasons behind the constant doomsday predictions — and it’s not about faith. It’s about fear. From dopamine spikes and trauma bonding to cognitive dissonance and psychological control, we’ll unpack how the Watchtower keeps millions addicted to the end of the world. 

Festinger, Leon; Riecken, Henry W.; Schachter, Stanley.
When Prophecy Fails (1956)
– Classic study of a doomsday cult and the phenomenon of cognitive dissonance when prophecies do not come true.

Carnes, Patrick.
The Betrayal Bond: Breaking Free of Exploitive Relationships (1997)
– Explains trauma bonding and how fear mixed with moments of relief leads to emotional dependence on abusers or abusive systems.

Ehrenreich, John.
Articles on disaster psychology and emotional responses to crisis narratives
– Discusses how repeated exposure to catastrophe framing can create dependency on crisis as a source of meaning and identity.

Watchtower Publications (multiple issues and talks)
Examples of repeated Armageddon predictions and their language of urgency:

The Watchtower, July 15, 2015: “We are living in the final part of the final part of the last days.”

Awake!, October 1968: “Why Are You Looking Forward to 1975?”

The Watchtower, May 1, 1984: “Some of the generation that saw the events of 1914 will live to see the end.”
#jehovah'switnessexposed, #watchtowersociety, #jwgoverningbody, #jwshunning,#disfellowshipping, #pimopomipomo, #jwculttactics, #jwdoctrinebreakdown, #exjw,#exjehovah'switness, #exjwtestimony, #exjwstory, #exjwexperience, #leavingjehovah'switnesses,#lifeafterjw, #exjwtruth, #jehovah'switnessexposed, #watchtowersociety, #jwgoverningbody,#jwshunning, #disfellowshipping, #pimopomipomo, #jwculttactics, #jwdoctrinebreakdown

episodes.title: Chapter 24 and 25: Multilanguage Fields and Shepherding
episodes.description:
Chapters 24 and 25 of the Shepherd the Flock of God manual outline how Jehovah’s Witness elders manage language learning, literacy, and personal shepherding. While framed as supportive spiritual guidance, these chapters reveal how tightly the organization controls members’ choices, behaviours, and even personal struggles, often prioritizing organizational goals over individual well-being. I look at the quiet pressure and expectations.
#JehovahsWitnesses #ExJW #CultControl #ReligiousTrauma #SpiritualAbuse #ShepherdTheFlock #WatchtowerTruth #JWReform #ExJWVoices #LeavingTheTruth

A big thank you to AvoidJW for having the manual uploaded.
https://files.accessjw.org/s/qPcTw2Hg87t9HXX

episodes.title: From Confident to Crushed: How Jehovah’s Witnesses Dismantle Your Self-Worth
episodes.description:
Today I want to talk about how Jehovah’s Witnesses tear down your confidence by controlling your thoughts, actions, and identity. With real examples from their own publications, it explains how men are silenced, women are kept small, and members are made to feel unworthy.

#exjw #jehovahswitnesses #cultawareness #religiouscontrol #religioustrauma #cultrecovery 




Watchtower, July 2013 (Simplified Edition), “What Future Will You Choose?”

Emphasizes that Jehovah’s love is connected to obedience and moral behavior, especially targeting youth.

Watchtower, 2019, “Elders—Be Examples to the Flock”

Encourages elders to avoid relying on their own understanding and highlights the need for obedience to direction from the organization.

Awake!, 2021, “What Is a Wife’s Role?”

Describes the woman as a complement to the man, encouraging submission and support roles for women.

Watchtower, October 2013, “Let Nothing Distance You From Jehovah”

Urges Witnesses to avoid all contact with disfellowshipped individuals, including family, in most cases.

Watchtower, May 2019, “What Should I Do With My Life?”

Strongly discourages pursuing higher education and portrays it as spiritually dangerous.

episodes.title: Chapters 22 & 23 - Tracked and Displayed: Files, Carts, and Control
episodes.description:
A behind-the-scenes look at how Jehovah’s Witnesses are meticulously documented and strategically deployed—filed, judged, then sent out to smile behind carts in public spaces, all under tight organizational control.

Thank you to AvoidJW 
https://files.accessjw.org/s/qPcTw2Hg87t9HXX

#exjw #cultawareness #cultrecovery #culttactics #jehovahswitnesses #religiouscontrol #religioustrauma

episodes.title: Chapter 21: Kingdom Halls - Where Worship Meets Micromanagement
episodes.description:
Chapter 21 dives into the meticulous rules governing every square inch of a Kingdom Hall—from inspections and safety hazards to video screens and voicemail scripts. Framed as spiritual oversight, it reveals just how deeply the organization controls even the carpets, calendars, and cleaning supplies, leaving little to local judgment and a lot to corporate-style command.

#exjw #jehovahswitnesses #cultawareness #cultrecovery #culttactics #religioustrauma #religiouscontrol

episodes.title: Remembering Malawi: Why We Must Keep Telling This Story
episodes.description:
Today I revisit the horrific ordeal faced by Jehovah’s Witnesses in Malawi and explains why it’s crucial to keep speaking about it. Through remembrance and awareness, we honour the victims, expose institutional hypocrisy, and ensure that such tragedies are never forgotten—or repeated.

#exjw #jehovahwitness #religiouscontrol #religioustrauma #cultawareness #cultrecovery 




Franz, Raymond. Crisis of Conscience. Commentary Press, 1983.
– A detailed insider account by a former Governing Body member, revealing internal Watchtower discussions, including the Malawi-Mexico policy contradiction.

Minority Rights Group International. Religious Minorities in Central Africa.
– A report highlighting the persecution of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Malawi, Mozambique, and Zambia.

“Persecution of Jehovah’s Witnesses.” Wikipedia.
– Overview of global persecution, with specific sections on the events in Malawi. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persecution_of_Jehovah's_Witnesses

United States Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF). Annual Reports on Religious Freedom.
– Includes sections addressing Jehovah’s Witnesses and incidents in Malawi.

“Malawi and Mexico – A Double Standard.” JWfacts.com.
– Analysis of Watchtower’s contradictory stances between Malawi and Mexico. https://www.jwfacts.com/watchtower/malawi-mexico.php

McCracken, John. Politics and Christianity in Malawi, 1875–1940: The Impact of the Livingstonia Mission in the Northern Province. Kachere Series, 2000.
– Provides historical and political context for religious movements in Malawi, including the roots of Witness persecution.

Reddit, exjw Subreddit. Discussions on the Malawi Crisis and Crisis of Conscience.
– Firsthand commentary and experiences from former Jehovah’s Witnesses reflecting on the Malawi ordeal.

episodes.title: Gaslight for God
episodes.description:
Today let's talk manipulation tactic of gaslighting and how it's used by Jehovah’s Witnesses to control members, rewrite history, and suppress critical thinking. With real examples, snarky commentary, and credible sources, this piece pulls back the curtain on spiritual abuse disguised as  truth. 

#exjw #jehovahwitness #religiouscontrol #religioustrauma #cultawareness 

American Psychological Association
APA Dictionary of Psychology: Gaslighting
Definition and psychological explanation.
Link: https://dictionary.apa.org/gaslighting

Watchtower Publications

The Watchtower, June 2017 – Claiming higher education is not discouraged.

The Watchtower, July 15, 2008, p. 4 – Warning against pursuing “worldly success.”

Awake!, May 1969 – Claiming schools “have a reputation for graduating atheists.”

The Watchtower, April 1, 1972, p. 197 – “We have never claimed to be inspired prophets.”

The Watchtower, September 1, 1919, p. 333 – “Present-day events fulfill prophecy.”

The Watchtower, August 15, 1981, p. 28 – “Where else would we go?”

The Watchtower, April 15, 1988, p. 26 – On limiting contact with disfellowshipped family.

Jenkinson, Gillie
Walking Free From Religious Trauma (2023)
A comprehensive guide on healing from spiritual and religious abuse by a cult recovery expert and ex-JW therapist.

Hassan, Steven
Freedom of Mind: Helping Loved Ones Leave Controlling People, Cults, and Beliefs (2020)
A leading book on cult mind control and recovery by a former Moonie and licensed mental health counselor.

episodes.title: Chapter 20 Meetings — Where Spirituality Gets Scheduled
episodes.description:
Chapter 20 of the Shepherd the Flock of God manual—where every meeting is choreographed down to the volume of the opening song, sisters need approval to interpret, and even canceled meetings require a spiritual chain of command. It’s not about worship—it’s about control and order.

Thank you AvoidJW

episodes.title: Soft Shunning: The JW Silent Treatment Special
episodes.description:
Still “in the truth” but suddenly invisible? Welcome to the bizarre world of soft shunning — where Jehovah’s Witnesses won't disfellowship you, but will treat you like you don’t exist. 

Watch, share, and don’t forget: you’re not alone. You're just waking up.
#culttactics #cultawareness #exjw #exjehovahwitness #jehovahswitnesses #religiousabuse #religioustrauma #religiouscontrol

episodes.title: When Faith Fails the Vulnerable: A Rebuke of the Watchtower’s Self-Harm Advice
episodes.description: My response to the dangers of the Watchtower’s article on cutting, highlighting the organization's lack of mental health training, failure to provide real support, and the harmful use of spiritual guilt to control vulnerable individuals.

episodes.title: Chapters 18 & 19: Disassociation and Reinstatement
episodes.description:
These two chapters are all about control and punishment. Chapter 18 outlines how to swiftly and publicly shame anyone who dares to disassociate — that is, leave the religion voluntarily. There’s no kindness, no appeal, and no grace period. You’re treated exactly like someone expelled for a serious sin, with your name announced and your social ties severed. Chapter 19 picks up where the shame leaves off, detailing the gruelling, conditional process of getting reinstated. It’s not about healing — it’s about proving loyalty through months (or years) of silence, obedience, and spiritual probation, all under the watchful eye of men with clipboards and superiority complexes.

Thank you to AvoidJW for having the manual.
https://files.accessjw.org/s/qPcTw2Hg87t9HXX

#exjw #religiouscontrol #religioustrauma #religiousabuse #cultawareness #cultrecovery #culttactics

episodes.title: Smiling Through Suffering: The Hidden Misery of Jehovah’s Witnesses
episodes.description:
Jehovah’s Witnesses are taught to smile, obey, and appear joyful — even when they’re quietly suffering inside. In this powerful and compassionate talk, we expose the hidden depression, anxiety, trauma, and addictions masked behind the so-called “spiritual paradise.” Some know they’re miserable. Others don’t — because they’ve been conditioned to believe that obedience equals happiness. 

#exjw #exjehovahwitness #cultawareness #cultrecovery #religiousabuse

episodes.title: Jehovah’s Witnesses and Informed Consent - When Obedience Replaces Understanding, Consent Isn’t Real
episodes.description:
What happens when religious devotion overrides personal autonomy? Today we talk about  how Jehovah’s Witnesses are denied true informed consent — in medical decisions, education, family, and even their right to think freely. Through fear, shame, and manipulation, members are pressured into compliance disguised as faith. This is not obedience. This is control. And it’s time we called it what it is.

#exjw  #freedomofspeech #freedomofcults #jehovahswitnesses #religiousabuse #religioustrauma

episodes.title: Chapter 17: Appeal Hearings-The Kangaroo Court Gets a Do-Over
episodes.description:
Today we get into Jehovah’s Witnesses' appeal process—where disfellowshipped members get a second chance to be judged by another handpicked group of yes-men. Spoiler: It’s not about justice, it’s about control, and this 'appeal' is just a dressed-up rerun of the original witch hunt.
 #exjw #cultawareness #religiousabuse #religiouscontrol #religioustrauma 

A big thank you to AvoidJW for putting the link up
https://files.accessjw.org/s/qPcTw2Hg87t9HXX

episodes.title: CHAPTER 16 - Procedure forJudicial Hearings
episodes.description:
Chapter 16 lays out the cold, calculated process Jehovah’s Witness elders follow to judge, restrict, reprove, or disfellowship members — all while calling it “loving discipline.” From secret note-taking to humiliation disguised as counsel, this chapter reveals how spiritual control is masked as mercy.

episodes.title: Would You Let Your Child Die for a Policy You Don’t Understand?
episodes.description:
Jehovah’s Witnesses are taught to refuse blood transfusions — but do they actually understand what that means? Let's look at the confusing history, shifting rules, and medically dangerous gaps in the Watchtower’s blood doctrine. We’ll break down the permitted fractions, examine the pressure members face, and ask the crucial question: how can anyone make a life-or-death decision if they don’t fully understand it? This is not about faith — it’s about informed consent.
#exjw #religiouscontrol #religioustrauma #religion #cultawareness 




Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society. The Watchtower, July 1, 1951; June 15, 2004 editions.

episodes.description:
Chapters 13 and 14 of the Jehovah’s Witness elder manual exposes how the organization mishandles serious misconduct behind closed doors—minimizing harm, protecting authority figures, and silencing victims. What they call shepherding is, in reality, a system of secrecy and control. It’s time to speak so loudly that the Kingdom Halls shake.

episodes.title: Shame on You Watchtower - You Lied. We Believed. Some of Us Died.
episodes.description:
The Watchtower’s doctrinal lies, deadly policies, and the human cost of “new light.” Truth doesn’t change — but the Watchtower always does.

#exjw #exjwsupport #cultawareness #religiousabuse 


Awake! October 8, 1968, p. 14 – “The generation of 1914… will not pass away.”
The Watchtower, November 1, 1995 – Redefined “generation” as a spiritual class.
The Watchtower, April 15, 2010 – Introduced the “overlapping generation” teaching.
The Watchtower, July 15, 2013 – Reassigned this identity solely to the Governing Body, changing previous teaching that all anointed were included.
Studies in the Scriptures Vol. 3, “Thy Kingdom Come” (1891) – Promoted the Great Pyramid of Giza as “God’s Stone Witness.”
The Watchtower, June 15, 2000 – Clarified use of blood fractions is a conscience matter.
The Watchtower, November 15, 1967, p. 702 – Labeled transplants as cannibalism.
The Watchtower, March 15, 1980, p. 31 – Reversal, allowing organ transplants as a conscience matter.
The Watchtower, June 1, 1929 – Reinterpreted “superior authorities” as Jehovah and Jesus.

episodes.title: Chapter 10: Circuit Overseer – Jehovah’s VIP Houseguest
episodes.description:
Chapter 10 of the Jehovah’s Witness elder manual, Shepherd the Flock of God. Let's talk about the hypocrisy, fake humility, and cult-like performance that surrounds the circuit overseer’s visit. From envelope cash handoffs to the congregation-wide panic to “look spiritual,” this isn’t hospitality—it’s spiritual theatre. And I’ve lived it.

episodes.description:

Beneath the polished smiles and spiritual lingo lies a system of unpaid labor, crushing expectations, and mental burnout. Pioneers are expected to sacrifice financial stability and emotional wellbeing to serve a billion-dollar organization—for free. This isn’t service—it’s spiritual servitude disguised as devotion.

episodes.title: Sacred Secrets: The Battle Over Privacy and Faith in British Columbia
episodes.description:
The legal battle between former Jehovah’s Witnesses and their B.C. congregations over personal privacy rights. This piece dives into Watchtower secrecy, court rulings, religious exemptions, and what’s at stake if the case hits the Supreme Court. With legal receipts and bold predictions, it’s a showdown between faith and accountability in Canada’s courts.

#exjw  #jehovahswitnesses #cultawareness #religioustrauma #religiouscontrol

episodes.title: Chapter 7 & 8 - Because Your Family’s Faith Is Now Your Job Review
episodes.description:
Chapters 7 and 8 of Shepherd the Flock of God pull back the curtain on the Jehovah’s Witnesses' obsession with control—framed as “loving oversight.” Chapter 7 outlines the role of the Field Service Group Overseer, a man tasked with monitoring every member's spiritual pulse like a door-to-door sales manager with divine authority. Chapter 8 goes deeper, revealing how appointments and deletions of elders and ministerial servants are less about spirit and more about optics, loyalty, and how well your family performs under theocratic pressure.

episodes.title: Taxed by Terror: How Jehovah’s Witnesses Turn Paranoia into a Full-Time Religion
episodes.description:
Today I’m on a rant about how Jehovah’s Witnesses turn fear into a full-time lifestyle. With constant warnings about Armageddon, pressure to report each other, and endless rules about what you can think, wear, or feel—this religion isn’t peaceful, it’s paranoia in a suit, a real estate empire, a con but today just the cost of living in chronic paranoia. 
#exjw #jehovahswitnesses #cultawareness #jwhealing #religiouscontrol

episodes.title: The Cult Club: You’re Not Special, You’re Just Next
episodes.description:
They say they’re the only ones with “The Truth.” But what happens when two religions both claim to be the one true path — and end up looking like spiritual clones? Let's peek at the striking (and kind of hilarious) similarities between Jehovah’s Witnesses and the secretive Two by Twos. From superiority complexes and shunning to male-only leadership and anti-intellectual control, it’s less “God’s chosen” and more “copy-paste cults.” Same fear, different font.
#cultawareness #exjw #religiouscontrol #religiousabuse

episodes.title: Jehovah’s Witnesses: Dying to Be Different
episodes.description:
They call it faith. I call it fatal. Today we dive into the cold, hard truth behind the Jehovah’s Witnesses’ no-blood doctrine—a policy that’s cost tens of thousands of lives and still gets paraded around as a badge of honor. From mothers who bled to death after childbirth to children denied life-saving treatment, this talk uncovers the deadly mix of fear, coercion, and spiritual superiority that fuels one of the religion’s most dangerous teachings. If you think refusing a transfusion is just a “personal choice,” buckle up—we’re about to blow the lid off that myth. Let’s talk about the lives lost, the families shattered, and the Watchtower's refusal to take any responsibility for its bloody legacy.
#exjehovahwitness #exjw #cultawareness #jwthink #religiouscontrol #religiousabuse 

Citations
Kitchens, C.S. (1993). "Bloodless surgery: the Jehovah’s Witness protocol." Southern Medical Journal.
Schmidt, T. et al. (2019). "Perioperative management of Jehovah’s Witness patients." BMC Anesthesiology.
Muramoto, O. (1998). "Medical ethics and Jehovah’s Witnesses: A reply to critics." Journal of Medical Ethics.
Gynecologic and Obstetric Investigation, 2016. “Maternal Mortality in Jehovah's Witnesses.”

Seattle Times (2007). “Teen Jehovah’s Witness dies after refusing blood.”
BBC News (1998). “Woman dies after refusing transfusion.”

episodes.title: Introduction to The Flock Gets Fleeced: Chapter by Chapter Breakdown
episodes.description:
Welcome to the series they really don’t want you to hear. We’re breaking down the Jehovah’s Witness Elders Manual—chapter by controlling chapter. It’s secretive, it’s shady, and it’s dripping in spiritual audacity. Let’s unpack the rules, the hypocrisy, and the culty control—one power trip at a time.

https://archive.org/details/2024-04-sfl-elder-manual/page/1/mode/2up

#exjw #jehovahswitnesses #cultawareness #religiouscontrol

episodes.title: Holy Hormones: Why Cults Can’t Stop Thinking About Your Sex Life
episodes.description:
Cults can’t stop talking about sex—but not because they care about your soul. It’s because controlling your sex life is the ultimate power move.
From banning dating and shaming desire, to micromanaging your marriage and silencing abuse—high-control religions have turned sex into a battlefield of guilt, shame, and obedience. And guess who’s always holding the sword? The leadership.
Cults weaponize sexuality—not to protect you, but to own you. We’re talking public humiliation, purity culture on steroids, and the twisted double standards that give predators cover while punishing victims.
If you’ve ever been told your body is dirty, your love is wrong, or your desires are dangerous... buckle up. It’s time to burn the shame and reclaim your power.
Because it was never about holiness.
 It was always about control.
#exjw #cultawareness #religiouscontrol

episodes.title: Boundaries, Baby — Because Your Peace Is Not Up for Debate
episodes.description:
f you’ve left the Jehovah’s Witness religion and your family still talks to you — that’s rare. But let’s be honest, it’s not always easy. The judgment, guilt, and pressure can feel overwhelming.

This 20-minute talk is all about how to set boundaries with JW family — without losing your cool or your peace. You’ll learn why boundaries are healthy, how to speak up for yourself, and why protecting your mental and emotional space is so important.

You’ll walk away with:

Clear examples of boundaries you can set

Ways to find your voice, even if it shakes

Reminders that you are allowed to say “no”

The confidence to put your well-being first

You are not selfish for wanting peace. You’re strong for choosing it.
Your life is yours now — protect it.
#excultmember #exjw #cultawareness #religiouscontrol

episodes.title: Shh… Don’t Think. The Governing Body Has Spoken
episodes.description: Ever wondered what happens when you're taught not to think for yourself? Welcome to the world of Jehovah’s Witnesses, where questioning is rebellion and obedience is salvation. I break down the wild reality of life in a high-control group that’s allergic to critical thinking. It’s bold, it’s smart, and it might just wake you up.
